Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class Server
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    Server is a class that waits for packets from the client and sends packets back to the client.
    See Also:
    JFrame, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • Server

        public Server()
        Constructs a Server. Sets up the GUI and Datagram socket connection.

    • Method Detail

      • waitForPackets

        public void waitForPackets()
        waitForPackets tries to receive packets from the client, display it, create a file from file name sent, and send the contents of the file back to the client.

      • sendPacketToClient

        private void sendPacketToClient​(java.net.DatagramPacket receivePacket,
                                byte[] newByte)
                         throws java.io.IOException
        sendPacketToClient takes the DatagramPacket received and replaces the contents with the contents of the file. It then sends the data back to the client and displays a message in the server window.
        Parameters:
        receivePacket - The DatagramPacket received from the client
        newByte - The file contents in a byte of data.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Exception thrown if data cannot be sent.

      • displayMessage

        private void displayMessage​(java.lang.String messageToDisplay)
        displayMessage manipulates displayArea in the even dispatch thread. This is done in a separate thread asynchronously.
        Parameters:
        messageToDisplay - the message to be displayed on the JTextArea
